text: Silvio Pettirossi International Airport is an international airport in Luque, Paraguay, serving Asunci√≥n, the nation's capital. It was opened on 11 June 1938. The airport is named after Paraguayan aviator Silvio Pettirossi. Between 1980 and 1989, it was known called President Stroessner International Airport, after the 42nd President of Paraguay Alfredo Stroessner. In 2023, it had 1,027,766 passengers. The airport is a hub for LATAM Paraguay and Paranair. == Other websites == * Category:1938 establishments Category:1930s establishments in South America Category:Airports in South America Category:Paraguay
title: Silvio Pettirossi International Airport
